title: Grades 9-12
subject: Career Development Framework For College and Career Readiness (2022-)

document.title: Maryland Career Development Framework For College and Career Readiness Grades Pre-K – Postsecondary (PS)/Adult

F8DFDFB8CF1F41F7861160EA41B44771.description:
Evaluate how technology has
changed and determine
implications for one’s lifelong
learning.

9E3AECE66A634128A4CC885EF13F5F3C.description:
Explain how society’s
needs/functions and economic
conditions affect one’s career
development (e.g. demographics,
global competition, economic
recession, and war).

E9EA0CF0550F40C2905DFFC7BCED1E0E.description:
Evaluate selection of specific
postsecondary education and
training programs as they relate
to changing societal and
economic conditions and update
personal and career goals.

1DD2866AEA72440FACD8CF0F746ABCFC.description:
Explain that our diverse and
changing economy requires the
updating of existing skills and
the acquisition of new skills
throughout life.

05F9FFCE317049EBA8AF77368F07C13C.description: Evaluate the impact of lifelong learning on one’s ability to function effectively in a diverse and changing economy.

BA6E171599154478A82B8DD064BBD755.description:
Analyze and compare school and
work needs with regard to
interests, skills, and values to
determine if long term goals are
met.

898DDD6AE6E44F58B14284F878DAF635.description:
Describe how education, work,
family issues, national crisis and
economic/labor market
conditions affect decisions.

CABD54BA57384109B7899A63506DF198.description:
Explain that many skills and
behaviors are needed to manage
one’s career development (e.g.
resiliency, self-efficacy, ability to
scan the environment for trends
and changes, having a futures
perspective, and flexibility).

7216AB92C9754B93BAFA4368409D47B7.description:
Determine changes and trends
that may impact career plans and
develop short- and long-term
goals.

EC7EE8AF8893411BB8883A1B04318696.description: Apply career management and decision-making skills to update ones’ career plan as needed.

ADC4B00CA9C340008DA0B55A4F465C4E.description:
Career Satisfaction and Transition – Individuals shall demonstrate how the ongoing attainment of knowledge and skills enhances one’s ability to function and transition
effectively in a diverse and changing economy.

89DA8AD307984024BC5494340B38E07E.description:
Make decisions about the
advantages and challenges of
employment in a non-traditional
career.

76C7E8D1BE684FA8AEFE173AE069470B.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in
transferable skills that lead to
advancement within a career
cluster of occupations (e.g.
business management finance
cluster: financial management
and accounting, legal services,
regulatory compliance, risk
management, government
relations, marketing.)

B85D76877ACC4BB7AE31FF806DE27CFB.description:
Demonstrate skills to seek
employment including writing a
resume and cover letter,
completing a job application,
interviewing for a job, finding
and pursuing employment leads
and marketing oneself in the
workplace.

C08F6376FA80439CB910BFDD5652DEA5.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in
academic and career-related
content standards, academic
content standards and Skills for
Success.

070753DE95CF405A9043C9819047039A.description: Understand how academic, technical, cross cluster and employability skills are needed to obtain or create, maintain, and advance in one’s career.

E44B286651174911889CB6EDEF2F0229.description: Job-Seeking and Advancement – Students shall demonstrate skills to secure, maintain and advance in employment

FD8F1DFE82244A02BAD7E753A7F88746.description:
Develop and complete the steps
and timelines for taking post
secondary entrance tests,
choosing and applying to
colleges / training programs, and
gaining admission, obtaining
financial aid (FAFSA) or
selecting employment options.

E2E2B0FAE6D04E919AC6D27CD899612A.description:
Identify problems and/or gaps in
the existing academic and career
plan annually.

2CAF41490D404F7B862D1FB7AE219A9E.description: Use the selected decision-making process/model to update and modify the six-year academic and career plan.

5CD731C414E04906854950F9F5961636.description:
Develop a career folder /portfolio
to demonstrate academic and
technical knowledge and skills of
a career cluster for employment
and postsecondary preparation.

1776D46D71FF475C8CB5AE8E031E7B4E.description:
Demonstrate academic and
career related skill and the Skills
for Success through projectbased learning and, if applicable,
CTE programs of study and other
career connecting activities

AE3920D26E074FE1B4628310FF96FEB7.description:
Apply academic and career –
related content knowledge and
skills (foundation, pathway, cross
cluster) through technology,
research, problem-solving, workbased learning, and project-based
learning.

8A678C2967524A9D9AE4AFCE6C858058.description:
Apply academic content
standards of the Maryland State
Curriculum

3623BAEBB8AE42AE8F8ABA07D3494826.description: Acquire cluster and academic content knowledge and skills to succeed in high school and beyond.

21DBF162DE8B4068B937D8D32703B796.description:
Career Preparation: Students shall prepare for postsecondary and career success through a sequenced academic and technical program of study and related workplace
experiences.

456A460B3A354D7D97A2CF526C66F216.description:
Describe the impact of one’s
culture, beliefs, and attitudes on
one’s career decisions.

7C6A449BBA2B4CA0A2939136181083B3.description:
Demonstrate the use of a
decision-making model to inform
academic and career planning on
an ongoing basis.

943250E623AA4036B75E3602C849D4B4.description: Use a process/model for knowing and thinking about how one makes decisions.

958BF1FFCA5D4B17B4EA8E2D44852433.description:
Select options for further
education and/or training (i.e.
dual enrollment, articulated
credit, advanced placement,
certification, two-year colleges,
four-year colleges,
apprenticeships, and technical
schools.)

D04520A2F7104512A4F3EC210AE941DC.description:
Apply academic/career-related
content standards including CTE
programs of study, if applicable,
to work-based learning
experiences and one’s program
sequence (high school plan).

8319C7D60A434C2AA1A5F20C78F2D5BA.description:
Design a program sequence for
selected academic/career options
including, if applicable, CTE
programs of study, postsecondary
education and/or training
opportunities.

A166970E1ABA45CEB59749B9A3667276.description:
Demonstrate the knowledge and
skills necessary to transfer
effectively from one learning
level to the next.

1A13A33B272C49DC96CA14FD5CE24AE1.description:
Review one’s academic and
career plan, including
postsecondary options and make
modifications on an annual basis

FA3174F4666D44B88DE9DE92B3A4C7BF.description:
Prepare an academic and career plan based on high school graduation requirements, a sequence of Career Technology Education (CTE) program of study courses,
related academics and postsecondary options.

9F9A680E85C9468999BC8F15B5536341.description:
Career Exploration – Students shall assess career cluster choices and related career pathways including Career Technology Education (CTE) programs of study in order to
develop an academic and career plan.

41267E20CBCF42D0A88686EC20AE99CE.description:
Identify the connections between
life roles and lifestyle.

4DBEDE3E1B4143C8B4765C3978DB3D57.description:
Examine one’s personal, leisure,
community, learner, work roles,
and responsibilities and illustrate
how they are interconnected.

D15520F68BAB45769F1AC108F61FB175.description: Understand that balancing personal, leisure, community, learner and work roles is an important part of one’s career development.

F2059DD5E7404778AF997F4CA2E45E67.description:
Apply decision-making may
involve compromise and cite
examples.

388EE66AC0D1409C99A05199EA09971A.description:
Examine the implications of
decisions, consider new
alternatives, and analyze the
need to compromise and its
effect on one’s decisions.

E337429AA2304C7C9D7219C0E5C20892.description:
Explain how one’s career
decision-making reflects
personal priorities (e.g.
financial, educational, leisure).

A0FD78E99F534FE5AE443ABBEF30C16E.description:
Evaluate the relationships
among education, skills, career
choices, economic conditions
and income.

379C5BFDDE7B4F0D8E0CAB22FEBD0A69.description:
Explore and evaluate career
information relevant to making a
decision.

62CCC2D4A008479E8D65B0FC9E03677B.description: Recognize that decision-making is an important part of an individual’s career development.

45C638F5B57E4D52A241D63F638DB507.description:
Evaluate career assessment
results to identify a career cluster
related academic courses and
program of study to inform
academic and career planning.

EDA49771EDD54E0D83E970DFB44FF999.description:
Demonstrate openness to and
consider career cluster and
options that one might view as
nontraditional (i.e. relative to
one’s gender, race, culture, or
ability.)

0530AD378BC9492ABCA4D70DFB45FAC0.description:
Compare and contrast earning
power with levels of education
and training of careers within
clusters of interest.

155D5CF051D14EE6B1DB7ADA44A74537.description:
Compare occupations and
careers within a career cluster
using labor market information
to determine post secondary
education opportunities
including two-year and four-year
college programs, certificate
programs, apprenticeship, and
trade school options.

B161C381B1454FA7BD6EEB6A4525510A.description:
Evaluate and identify relevant
career information resources to
use in selecting and planning for
a career cluster and career
pathway. (i.e., economic, labor
market, and employer-specific).

8D85FED008C247C888560B7B17B3D547.description: Understand how accurate, current and unbiased career information is necessary for successful career planning and management using career clusters

0B26F15A3BDF400B8DD93B81887C044A.description:
Use technology to access, store,
manage, analyze and
communicate information to
enhance and improve
achievement.

A902601487A14DABA1ED8FF5149499D2.description:
Use study skills, strategies and
learning habits to improve
achievement.

33809439FE964DA2B7F2258ABADEEE46.description:
Prioritize educational
achievement areas needing
improvement and develop a plan
to obtain proficiency of one’s
personal and career goals.

5C8E20E0FCF549A386C48C4958BE6485.description:
Analyze the connections
between one’s educational
achievement and personal and
career goals and adjust behavior
in a way that integrates the
strong connections.

E6E737476D124F7EBF080DAEB3B69CDB.description:
Assess past, present, and future
informal and formal learning
experiences that connect to one’s
life goals.

EFA0862AFAE74F94A9A89563C6DFA511.description: Understand the connections among educational achievement, lifelong learning and the career options across career pathways.

6220E077819249EA95FAA6B1D9924719.description:
Compare/contrast the shift in the
work organization of the 21st
century versus the past.

CB1557826EDD4742886BAA35ADC6357B.description:
Determine academic and career
related goals

588D83AEF23E4F6D86F36870405B62A5.description:
Identify and research career
clusters and CTE programs of
interest.

550771AD5BA34924857F5FAE274A4F34.description: Analyze/compare the industries represented in Maryland’s 10 Career Clusters and how they relate to the needs and functions of the economy and society.

E1A8874CA1D84C218DD8233A34AE072C.description:
Career Awareness – Students shall use the Maryland Career Clusters and career pathways including Career and Technology Education (CTE) programs of study in order to
understand their relationship to educational achievement and life-long learning.

FF009AFA7EF44D898F4A616EF9B843B2.description:
Identify financial choices based
on available resources, needs,
and wants for goods and services

6EE0E9BD0F1E49EA9D3A061E0D87F4CC.description:
Revise academic and career plan
to reflect growth and
development.

9CADA4EF073840158B2E3692DD6A16D0.description:
Plan and follow steps to make
effective decisions and achieve
goals for learning and
performance.

FB24C735A7F345E4A2E7AA2521D12632.description: Apply self-knowledge to decision-making and goal-setting.

BD9DF28AA7DE486CB8D783913AA20643.description:
Explain how motivations and
aspirations changed with time
and circumstance.

C6EC4969823644389143FFCD82254526.description:
Demonstrate and analyze how
effectively one responds to
change and/or initiates change.

AA3EF15681BD46B18F194D8212BD2B7E.description:
Identify situations (e.g. applying
to college, seeking employment,
experiencing problems in school,
encountering financial
instability, developing a
disability, and design strategies
to access resources, including
other people, to seek assistance
when needed.

E3D2249D4CB24DD18EE1D65EE6A5E559.description:
Analyze the results of personal
growth and change throughout
life to determine future growth
opportunities.

4FAC05624AC0456E89FE6D3D8E0E7C4B.description: Recognize that growth and change are integral parts of the career development process.

18629416C98649EB960935D586A3BB0E.description:
Demonstrate, problem-solve, and
evaluate communication
experiences and use of effective
strategies such as paraphrasing,
reflections, active listening, and
assertive communication.

C364F2FC0BE240D9B9EE3CA745D90C11.description:
Demonstrate the ability to support
group decisions, respect
dissenting positions, and/or use
consensus.

17827322694A45DEA351FC3BF217F7D3.description:
Evaluate individual and group
performance and plan
improvements using explicit
criteria.

1106D48C96934134898256BEB29A4941.description:
Demonstrate and assess the
degree to which one accepts
responsibility for personal actions
including dealing with outside
pressures and contributing to
group activities.

90464A4C8E1C4D2B9C9B1C728C273CE8.description:
Monitor and adjust behavior in
group activities in a way that is
honest, fair, helpful, and
respectful.

17C474167748499C81E4CD9BB03E1FF7.description: Demonstrate positive interpersonal skills and respect for diversity to facilitate one’s career development.

A81EA6ED27CD4A8496F475D515563BAA.description:
Evaluate how the impact of
situations, attitudes, and the
behaviors of others affect selfconcept and how behaviors and
attitudes affect the self-concept
of others.

8B1EE2B12AF64CFF92F6EC27F408B880.description:
Explain and assess how one’s
self-concept affects and
promotes both educational
achievement and success at
work.

98C00581389D41E6945C0F7663241A1D.description:
Evaluate how positive personal
characteristics affect career
decisions and planning.

8959C544BAAD47CB947FB77B169D93B3.description:
Integrate a broad range of
interests into personal learning
and career goals, and assess the
impact of abilities, strengths,
skills, and talents on career
planning.

A9DA56E965CB43C0A2AD91321CB3E31A.description: Acquire and apply self-knowledge to understand one’s abilities, strengths, interests, skills, and talents as seen by self and others.

7A37C6D5490D4365B3159C032A0535EA.description: Self-Awareness – Students shall acquire and apply self-knowledge in order to develop personal, learning and career goals.
